page.title: 05 HISTORY OF KENNINGTON-1
page.content: Since the original {DOMESDAY BOOK,} Kennington has grown in size. It was originally a very small Saxon settle- ment with primitive tracks which during Norman times progressed to three streets:{BALL LANE, THE STREET} and{ULLEY ROAD}which can be seen in { {1985.}In early years, {KENNINGTON}was famous for {WILLOW TREES}which were used to make Willow baskets. The horses had no mains water and most large houses had a well. {KENNINGTON} has had various names since the original Domesday Book, varying from { {CHINTON}in 1072 AD, {CHENETONE}in 1086 AD, {KENINTUNA}in 1157 AD, {KENINGTON in 1254 AD and then {KENNINGTON}in 1610 AD, which is how it is spelt in 1985. In the past{KENNINGTON}and the nearby village of {WYE}were sworn enemies.
